result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dontrell Carnell Anderson

records.addlTxt: Defense enters NEW SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. EXPIRES 01/12/2023.
Court adjusts cash bail down to $250.00, due to the Court not being able to comply with the speedy trial demand.

Defendant Dontrell Carnell Anderson in court, in custody.  Attorney Ashley Fard in court for Dontrell Carnell Anderson.  Prosecuting attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Final Pre-Trial. State counsel requests an adjournment, due to crime lab testing results not being presented to the State in a timely fashion. Objections from defense. Court grants the State's adjournment request due to reasons placed on the record and sets the following deadlines:  11/03/2022 deadline for the State to respond to defense's motion. 12/05/2022 deadline for the state to turn over crime lab testing results. Court further vacates the 10/17/2022 jury trial date and sets new final pre-trial and jury trial dates.
Jury trial scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Received and Filed. MOTION TO LIMIT STATES WITNESS TO EXPOSITION TESTIMONY -DAUBERT CHALLENGE
Received and Filed. NOTICE OF MOTION TO ADJOURN
Addendum to State's Witness List; received and filed.
State's Witness List.  Received and Filed.  nk
State's Motion in Limine.  Received and Filed. nk
State's Response to Defendant's Denny Motion.  Received and Filed. nk
Defendant's Motion and Brief in Support to Introduce Evidence at Trial that Dominique Johnson Committed the Crime, filed
Received and filed; forwarded to the Judge for review.

Attorney Ashley Fard in court, defendant Dontrell Carnell Anderson not in court, in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference.  Demand for Speedy Trial entered on 7-21-22 and expires on 10-19-22.  Court scheduled motion hearing/final pre-trial and jury trial dates upon request from the Defense.  Status conference scheduled on 8-5-22 CANCELLED.  Court ordered State's reponse to be filed by September 30, 2022 and all final pre-trial documents to be filed by October 7, 2022.  Case adjourned to Branch 16, Rm 503 CH.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed: Motion to Suppress Physical Evidence
Received and Filed: Demand for Speedy Trial (7-21-22)
Letter From Defendant ( Dontrell Anderson # 2022005785- 949 N 9th Street Milwaukee, WI 53233)

Attorney Ashley Fard in court via zoom, defendant Dontrell Carnell Anderson not in court, in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defendant not produced. Defense counsel informs court that they have received discovery materials, but needs additional time to review with client. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Dontrell Carnell Anderson in court, defendant in custody with attorney Ashley Fard appear by video. Annie Louk appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer Z.Cvetan.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and filed

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Dontrell Carnell Anderson in court with attorney Robert W Peterson.  Defendant Dontrell Carnell Anderson in custody.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dontrell Carnell Anderson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
